intro: Clintonia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded woodland environments and is often found in rich, well-drained soils. Clintonia corymbosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in forest ecosystems.
